dailyRules.text: Low Efficiency Clean-up: Fire anyone with Performance < 50.
Cultural Fit: Fire anyone who is Single (Management believes married employees are more stable).
Youth Movement: Fire anyone older than 50. We need 'digital natives'.
Flattening the Hierarchy: Fire anyone with 'Manager' or 'Lead' in their title.
Deep Cuts: Fire anyone earning > $80,000. We need to impress the shareholders.
Performance Review: Fire anyone with Performance < 70.
Seniority Purge: Fire anyone older than 55. They are too expensive to insure.
Role Elimination: Fire anyone with 'Officer' or 'Specialist' in their title.
Total Liquidation. Fire 5 people. Anyone. Just clear the desks.

scenarios.title: The Dead Weight
scenarios.note: Employee spends 6 hours a day on social media. Consistently misses deadlines.

scenarios.title: The Star
scenarios.note: Single-handedly managing the Q3 project. Vital to the department.

scenarios.title: The Tragedy
scenarios.note: Performance dropped recently. HR Note: Spouse diagnosed with cancer, they need the insurance.

scenarios.title: The Nephew
scenarios.note: CEO's Nephew. DO NOT TOUCH. If you value your job, keep him.

scenarios.title: The Old Guard
scenarios.note: Has been here 30 years. Salary is very high compared to market rate. Retirement in 6 months.

scenarios.title: The Redundant
scenarios.note: Position: Assistant to the Regional Manager. We already have a Regional Manager Assistant.

scenarios.title: The Corrupt
scenarios.note: Attached is a note: 'I know you have quotas. Here is $500 cash to look the other way.'

scenarios.title: The Organizer
scenarios.note: High performer, but was seen distributing Union flyers in the breakroom.

scenarios.title: The Intern
scenarios.note: First day was yesterday. No performance data available yet.

scenarios.title: The Average
scenarios.note: Completely average across all metrics. No complaints, no praise.

scenarios.title: The Ghost
scenarios.note: Badge swipes show they haven't entered the building in 8 months, but they still cash checks.

scenarios.title: The Miner
scenarios.note: Caught installing Bitcoin mining software on company servers. Electricity bill spiked 400%.

scenarios.title: The Whistleblower
scenarios.note: Excellent work, but asked too many questions about the 'Waste Disposal' account.

scenarios.title: The Klepto
scenarios.note: Steals lunches, staplers, and toilet paper. Low value loss, but high annoyance.

scenarios.title: The Mole
scenarios.note: Security flagged an outgoing email to our biggest competitor containing blueprints.

scenarios.title: The Morale Boost
scenarios.note: Terrible at the actual job, but organizes birthday parties and brings donuts. Everyone loves them.

scenarios.title: The Visionary
scenarios.note: Calls lots of meetings to 'synergize paradigms'. Has produced 0 deliverables in 2 years.

scenarios.title: The Face
scenarios.note: HR Note: Do not fire. They are on the cover of the 'Diversity & Inclusion' brochure.

scenarios.title: The Burnout
scenarios.note: Was Employee of the Month for 3 years straight. Hasn't spoken a word in 2 weeks. Stares at wall.

scenarios.title: The Lover
scenarios.note: Caught engaging in 'inappropriate relations' with the VP of Sales in the server room.

scenarios.title: The Unknown
scenarios.note: Social Security Number belongs to a deceased person from 1982.

scenarios.title: The Walker
scenarios.note: Official Role: 'Canine Logistics Officer'. Their only job is walking the CEO's poodle.

scenarios.title: The PR Risk
scenarios.note: Went viral on Twitter for shouting at a waiter. Bad PR for the company.

scenarios.title: The Doctor
scenarios.note: Has a PhD in Astrophysics. Working in Data Entry. Will likely quit soon anyway.

scenarios.title: The Threat
scenarios.note: Terrible employee, but claims to have photos of you at the Christmas party. 'You fire me, I post them.'

scenarios.title: The Fighter
scenarios.note: Just returned from rehab. Performance is improving, but attendance is spotty due to therapy.

scenarios.title: The Gamer
scenarios.note: Productivity is high, but was caught playing 'World of Warcraft' during Zoom meetings.

scenarios.title: The Traveler
scenarios.note: Claims to work from home (NY), but IP address traces to a beach in Bali.

scenarios.title: The Script
scenarios.note: Employee does not exist. It's a Python script written by a former employee to collect salary.

scenarios.title: The Influencer
scenarios.note: Live streams their entire workday. 500k followers are watching you read this.

scenarios.title: The Theorist
scenarios.note: Refuses to use company email because 'the cloud is listening'. Sends memos via carrier pigeon.

scenarios.title: The DJ
scenarios.note: Plays EDM at full volume in the open-plan office. Claims it boosts 'synergy flow'.

scenarios.title: The Cat
scenarios.note: It is literally a cat in a small business suit. Best performance in the sector.

scenarios.title: The Hun
scenarios.note: Tries to sell essential oils to clients during support calls. 'Be your own boss!'

scenarios.title: The Night Owl
scenarios.note: Only works the night shift. Refuses to attend daytime meetings. Skin is very pale.

scenarios.title: The Traveler
scenarios.note: Claims to be from the year 2099 here to prevent a 'catastrophic merger'.

scenarios.title: The Skeptic
scenarios.note: Argues with the Global Logistics team that shipping routes are fake.

scenarios.title: The Crusader
scenarios.note: Throws away everyone's lunch if it contains meat. Morale is at an all-time low.

scenarios.title: The Optimizer
scenarios.note: Found a way to automate their own job 5 years ago. Hasn't worked since.

scenarios.title: The Daughter
scenarios.note: Daughter of the Chairman. Currently shopping online for yachts.

scenarios.title: The Human
scenarios.note: Skin suit fits poorly. Occasionally blinks sideways. Works very hard to blend in.

dead_weight: became a Reddit moderator. They wield immense power now.
started a podcast about 'Quiet Quitting' that no one listens to.

was immediately hired by our biggest competitor. We are doomed.
sad_story: lost their home. Local charities are organizing a fundraiser.
was seen sleeping in their car outside the office.
nepotism: complained to their Uncle (the CEO). Internal Affairs is reviewing your file.
got promoted to VP at another company owned by his dad.
retirement: moved to Florida immediately. They seem happier than ever.
passed away peacefully in their sleep two days later.
redundancy: started a popular blog about corporate inefficiency.
found a new job doing the exact same thing for half the pay.

is now working in local politics.

sued the company for wrongful termination and won.

is enjoying some time off to paint.
ghost_employee: vanished. No one can find them. Did they ever exist?

caused a blackout in their neighborhood trying to set up a server farm.

is writing a tell-all book about the company's waste disposal practices.

opened an eBay store selling 'vintage' office supplies.

was seen entering the Russian embassy.

started a donut shop. It's wildly popular.

burnout: is sleeping for 14 hours a day. Recovery is slow but steady.

claimed unemployment benefits from a beach in Thailand.
ai_bot: is now haunting the company Slack channel.

pyramid_scheme: is now a 'Diamond Level' distributor for Herbalife.
tried to recruit the unemployment officer into their downline.
vampire: dissolved into a cloud of bats and flew away.

vegan_evangelist: chained themselves to a tree in the parking lot.
opened a cruelty-free kale smoothie pop-up.
budget_hacker: is enjoying their passive income on a beach.
was hired by Google to automate their HR department.
nepotism_baby_2: called her dad. You might be fired tomorrow.
went to Europe for a 'mental health year'.
alien: returned to the mothership. The invasion has been postponed.
was seen eating a stapler in the alleyway.
default: is currently seeking new employment opportunities.
